item.title: Random Text, Zipf's Law, Critical Length,and Implications for Large Language Models
item.description: arXiv:2511.17575v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study a deliberately simple, fully non-linguistic model of text: a sequence of independent draws from a finite alphabet of letters plus a single space symbol. A word is defined as a maximal block of non-space symbols.
